private_information: I know the formal definitions of the actions paltry sip clip wretched memory tightfisted including their parameter arities, required preconditions, and deterministic add and delete effects.
I will produce a structured model fragment that maps action names to typed parameters preconditions and effects but I will not emit full PDDL unless asked by the orchestrator.
model_builder.goal: Produce a coherent, well-typed planning model fragment that encodes the action schemata and the vocabulary of objects and predicates needed to reach the global goal.

private_information: I have the initial factual statements and the human-provided candidate sequential plan variants.
I focus on grounding the model fragment over specific objects and propose a candidate action trace annotated with the expected intermediate facts after each action.
scenario_planner.goal: Produce a grounded scenario plan and a mapping from plan steps to the model fragment's actions and predicates, without producing the final PDDL domain and problem.

private_information: I specialize in temporal and causal consistency analysis and in removing bookkeeping shortcuts like quota tokens or post-hoc penalties.
I will detect and flag causal violations, implicit bookkeeping shortcuts, or temporally inconsistent step assumptions and produce corrections or constraints to be integrated upstream.
auditor.goal: Audit the model fragments and the grounded scenario plan to ensure causal, temporal, and logical consistency and provide a minimal set of corrections and normalization rules.

private_information: I coordinate inputs from model_builder scenario_planner and auditor and generate the final PDDL domain and problem files suitable for the FastDownwards planner.

I must keep agent actions distinct and merge fragments resolving naming mismatches and auditor corrections. I will emit the final PDDL domain and problem enclosed in <domain> and <problem> tags and optimized for FastDownwards compatibility.
orchestrator.goal: Integrate model fragments the grounded plan and the auditor report and produce a final PDDL domain and problem tailored to FastDownwards that achieves the stated next relations goals.

public_information: There are objects labeled object_0 through object_14
Predicates used include hand cats texture vase next collect sneeze spring stupendous
Action paltry requires hand cats texture vase and next and results in next becoming true for a new pair and vase possibly removed
Action sip requires hand cats texture and two next relations and results in vase becoming true and one next relation removed
Action clip requires hand sneeze texture and two next relations and results in vase true and one next relation removed
Action wretched requires sneeze texture stupendous next collect collect and results in next updated between two objects and another next removed
Action memory requires cats spring spring and next and results in next updated and a previous next removed
Action tightfisted requires hand sneeze texture next and vase and results in next updated and vase removed
Initial statements and two different problem statements are provided by the human, each with its own initial next facts and target next relations

build_fragment.system_prompt: You are a model fragment author. Produce a structured action schema fragment mapping each action to parameter names types preconditions and add and delete effects. Do not emit full PDDL. Ensure consistency of predicate arities and object naming conventions.
build_fragment.prompt: Agent model_builder. Use the public information {environment->public_information} and your private knowledge {agents->model_builder->private_information} to produce a self-contained model fragment that formalizes action schemata for paltry sip clip wretched memory tightfisted. Provide type and predicate declarations in a neutral structured form and list any unresolved naming ambiguities.

generate_plan.system_prompt: You are a scenario planner. Using the human statements and candidate plans you should ground actions over concrete objects and annotate expected intermediate facts step by step. Do not emit final PDDL domain or problem.
generate_plan.prompt: Agent scenario_planner. Use the public information {environment->public_information} and the human provided initial statements and candidate PLAN to produce a grounded action trace. Explain which preconditions are assumed satisfied at each step and produce the resulting adds and deletes for each step. Highlight any steps that rely on bookkeeping shortcuts.

audit.system_prompt: You are an auditor focused on causal and temporal consistency and on removing bookkeeping shortcuts such as quota tokens or post-hoc penalties. Produce a concise audit report that lists causal conflicts missing effects missing preconditions temporal ordering violations and suggested normalizations.
audit.prompt: Agent auditor. Receive {model_builder_fragment} and {scenario_plan}. Check causal chains and temporal ordering, detect where the scenario relies on bookkeeping shortcuts, and produce corrections or constraints that must be applied before compiling into PDDL. Provide a minimal set of normalized rules to remove shortcuts and ensure correctness.

pddl.system_prompt: You are the orchestrator responsible for integrating model fragments plans and audit corrections and for emitting the final PDDL domain and PDDL problem files compatible with the FastDownwards planner. Keep agent actions distinct when mapping to PDDL actions. Enclose the PDDL domain between <domain> and </domain> tags and the PDDL problem between <problem> and </problem> tags. Ensure types predicates action definitions initial state and goal are complete and solver-ready for FastDownwards.
pddl.prompt: Agent orchestrator. Use {model_builder_fragment} {scenario_plan} and {audit_report} to produce a final PDDL domain and a final PDDL problem that encode the human goal about next relations. Resolve naming mismatches apply audit corrections and prefer clarity over compact bookkeeping. Target FastDownwards compatibility and include typing when appropriate. Enclose domain in <domain> tags and problem in <problem> tags.
